definition: to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort

sentences.english: Usually songs that are good to dance have terrible words.
sentences.chinese: 通常來說，可以用來伴舞的歌曲歌詞都很差勁。

sentences.english: When Peng Liyuan begins to sing, 16 actresses in Tibetan clothes accompany her with dance.
sentences.chinese: 彭麗媛演唱，十六名藏族服飾的女演員爲她伴舞。

sentences.english: Or maybe just your nine dancers?
sentences.chinese: 或者只要你的九個伴舞？

sentences.english: I don't have half-naked male dancers or anything like that.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有半裸的男伴舞，或者其他類似的東西。

sentences.english: Be a back up dancer at a karaoke bar.
sentences.chinese: 在一家卡拉OK酒吧做伴舞演員。

sentences.english: Teachers and parents chaperoned the school dance.
sentences.chinese: 老師們和家長們在學校舞會上伴舞。

sentences.english: And do you personally hand-pick the dancers?
sentences.chinese: 那些伴舞的人員都是你親自挑選出來的麼？

sentences.english: Michael's already pretty much put together a list of the dancers he wants.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾已經差不多列出了他想要的伴舞者的名單。

definition: vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
announce the items on a (theatrical) program
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
